posts.post_content:
A few people seem confused about why the equipped creature receives double damage. It's one of the  [Inquisitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=246949)'s weapons and it requires their skills to use it properly (first strike, protection from the enemies you're fighting). Greatly flavorful.  
  
If any of *us* tried using a flail, we'd probably end up breaking our own arms in the process.
posts.html:

If any of us tried using a flail, we'd probably end up breaking our own arms in the process.

posts.post_content: The level of fun to be had with either [Phyrexian Obliterator](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Obliterator) or [Mirran Crusader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirran Crusader) and other strong cards is not to be underestimated. Even creatures without an ability like First Strike (such as [Accorder Paladin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Accorder Paladin)) suddenly are hitting for six when they would have died from any amount of damage anyway allowing them to trade with things much larger or just taking great wallops out of your opponent's life total.
posts.html:
The level of fun to be had with either Phyrexian Obliterator or Mirran Crusader and other strong cards is not to be underestimated. Even creatures without an ability like First Strike (such as Accorder Paladin) suddenly are hitting for six when they would have died from any amount of damage anyway allowing them to trade with things much larger or just taking great wallops out of your opponent's life total.

Posted By: DritzD27 (11/12/2011 5:21:06 AM)
Rating:

@RJDroid: of course it was unexpected. NO ONE ever expects the spanish inquisition. Their chief weapons are surprise, first strike, and flails.
Well, sorry, but someone had to say it.

This is one of the coolest pieces of equipment ever, IMO. It's awesome to see how no one cares about its drawback - first strike (double strike being too evil/fun to even mention), indestructibility (yeah, I know that's not a keyword), or just you not caring about your creature's survival. Sure to be welcome in a lot of decks (at least in casual).

Posted By: Lash_of_Dragonbreath (12/13/2011 5:46:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: This card is great in a Knight deck where many Knights already have first strike. if they don't you can clear the way with [Brave the Elements](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Brave the Elements). On [Mirran Crusader](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mirran Crusader) you can deal 4x damage. Also works great when [Knight Exemplar](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight Exemplar) is out because then it doesn't matter how much damage your Knight takes - he's indestructible! Another combo is to have [Kinsbaile Cavalier](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kinsbaile Cavalier) out and attach the Flail to [Knight of Meadowgrain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knight of Meadowgrain). Now your Knight is a life-gaining powerhouse. Great card if the deck is right. Solid 4 out of 5.
posts.html:

It's already been mentioned, but Gisela seems like a great fit for this. Her first strike ability keeps the second effect of the equipment from kicking in that often. Oh, and she of course swings for ***20 damage*** with it.

posts.post_content:
When [Gisela, Blade of Goldnight](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gisela, Blade of Goldnight) comes out, if you equip 4 of these to any one creature and you have Gisela out, that creature will do 32 times it's normal damage!  
  
EDIT: @ JontheRed: It was implied that you could do that.  
  
Anyway, it actually is 32 times the damage, because doubling the damage stacks, so it's 2 x 2 x 2 x 2 x 2. So, with Gisela equipped, that would be 160 damage.
posts.html:
When Gisela, Blade of Goldnight comes out, if you equip 4 of these to any one creature and you have Gisela out, that creature will do 32 times it's normal damage!

EDIT: @ JontheRed: It was implied that you could do that.

Anyway, it actually is 32 times the damage, because doubling the damage stacks, so it's 2 x 2 x 2 x 2 x 2. So, with Gisela equipped, that would be 160 damage.

posts.post_content:
@VampireDucky *Inquisitor's Flail* and [Stuffy Doll](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Stuffy Doll), huh?  
This isn't such a bad combo even though it won't get any advantage from the card's first ability at all (since it only triggers for *combat* damage).  
So ironically it will only profit from the general drawback, since it still doubles the damage inflicted on itself or from potential incoming attackers, or even burn spells that you might have packed in your Stuffy Doll deck, too.  
  
 I think i prefer other cards to combine with either of those two artifacts, though.
posts.html:
@VampireDucky Inquisitor's Flail and Stuffy Doll, huh?
This isn't such a bad combo even though it won't get any advantage from the card's first ability at all (since it only triggers for combat damage).
So ironically it will only profit from the general drawback, since it still doubles the damage inflicted on itself or from potential incoming attackers, or even burn spells that you might have packed in your Stuffy Doll deck, too.

I think i prefer other cards to combine with either of those two artifacts, though.
